intro: Malouetia tamaquarina, commonly known as the Tamaquarina tree, is a species native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows up to 10 meters in height. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, often with a fragrant scent. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its propagation in the wild.
